query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

result.title: Utilities Cadastre and lack of infrastructure design in GIS environment
result.description: The document describes the use of GIS tools for geographic identification of Hot spots on energy water telecommunication and waste systems better for immediately management to act in response The main objective of the document is o contribute to mitigation and adaptation to the need vs crisis by providing methodologies and tools using time series of GIS data and imagery optical SAR Geodetical GPS for GIS in combination with demographic data and auxiliary data from the query bases of the utility providers

result.title: Risk-based decision-making (stage 2)
result.description: A report on the developed riskbased decisionmaking models and tools will be produced The models and tools supported by software codes will focus on the nature of stochastic and uncertain environment The report will cover development of decision support tools for riskbased uncertainty analysis The report will be updated on 6month basis The findings will be submitted to journals or conference for publication

result.title: Quantitative/Qualitative Mapping Urban health across the pilot studies and for specific sites identified as ‘hot spots' during the analysis
result.description: D42 QuantitativeQualitative Mapping Urban health across the pilot studies and for specific sites identified as hot spots during the analysis Delivery date M14 the use of traditional data sets eg census with more recent approaches of crowdsourcing data eg content analysis using twitter will create a mixmethods approach that will enable innovative methodologies to deliver detailed analysis of the current landscape of health and wellbeing for the selected cities Also it will allow to zoom in to particular cases that due to the quality of the results might pose interesting avenues to conduct further research
